item.description:
A reading to celebrate the launch of White Whale Review: an online journal of poetry, short fiction, and nonfiction.

Readers to include:
GEORGE KALOGERIS teaches humanities and literature at Boston University and at Suffolk University in Boston, Massachusetts. He recently published a book of poems based on the notebooks of Albert Camus entitled Camus: Carnets (Pressed Wafer). His poems have appeared in Agni, Harvard Review, and Ploughshares.

SUMITA CHAKRABORTY is the assistant poetry editor at AGNI Magazine, a Cambridge resident, and a graduate of Wellesley College. She writes poetry and critical nonfiction, and has studied with Lucie Brock-Broido, Dan Chiasson, Pankaj Mishra, and Frank Bidart. Most recently, a poem of hers appeared in BOXCAR Poetry Review.

DAN MURPHY began to speak when he was six years old, smoke when he was eight, drink when he was fourteen, and read when he was twenty-one. He has worked as a painter, carpenter, college English teacher, and a family therapist. He has published in numerous journals such as The Comstock Review, International Journal of Literature, Parnassus Literary Journal, Salmon Magazine, Soundings East and others.

Also featuring a short story by RACHEL COYE.
item.name: Launch Reading for White Whale Review
